content.text:
# Draft:Forward (The Swell Season album)

Forward is the upcoming third studio album by Irish–Czech folk rock duo The Swell Season. It is scheduled for release on 13 June 2025 through Masterkey Sounds and Plateau. It will be the band's first full-length studio album in 16 years, following their Oscar-winning success with the film Once and its soundtrack.
Background
Following a series of sold-out reunion shows, including Radio City Music Hall in New York, Glen Hansard and Markéta Irglová returned to the studio in Iceland. Originally planning to record just a few songs for their tour, the sessions resulted in a full-length album. Forward was produced by Sturla Mio Thorisson and recorded at Masterkey Studios in Iceland.
The album reunites the original Swell Season lineup, including Marja Gaynor (violin, viola), Bertrand Galen (cello), and Joseph Doyle (bass), with Piero Perelli joining on drums and percussion.
Music and themes
Forward will feature eight tracks written and performed by Hansard and Irglová, who alternate as lead vocalists. The album builds upon the band's established sound while introducing new influences and collaborative dynamics.
Track listing
All songs written by Glen Hansard and Markéta Irglová.
# "Factory Street Bells"
# "People We Used to Be"
# "Stuck in Reverse"
# "I Leave Everything to You"
# "Little Sugar"
# "Pretty Stories"
# "Great Weight"
# "Hundred Words"
Personnel
* Glen Hansard – vocals, guitar
* Markéta Irglová – vocals, piano
* Marja Gaynor – violin, viola
* Bertrand Galen – cello
* Joseph Doyle – bass guitar
* Piero Perelli – drums, percussion
Production
* Sturla Mio Thorisson – producer, recording engineer
Release
Forward is scheduled to be released on 13 June 2025.
References
External links
